metadata.title: CVE-2023-51780 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 6.6.8. do_vcc_ioctl innet/atm/ioctl.c has a use-after-free because of a vcc_recvmsg racecondition.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-51780` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-222.233
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-222.233
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-222.233
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-222.233
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-222.233
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1143-kvm - 4.15.0-1149.154
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1159-aws - 4.15.0-1165.178
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1168-azure - 4.15.0-1174.189
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1153-gcp - 4.15.0-1159.176
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1122-oracle - 4.15.0-1128.139
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-222.233').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
